revised_title: Foetal Rabbit Serum Protein Electrophoresis and Maternal Protein Transfer
tldr: The study examines the serum proteins of foetal rabbits and their mothers, finding differences in total protein concentration and component proportions. Foetal sera contain components corresponding to albumin, a-, /?- and y-globulin, but their proportions differ from both pregnant and non-pregnant adult rabbits. The research also explores the transfer of maternal proteins to the foetus and its implications for passive immunity.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
